intro: Neillia ribesioides, commonly known as the silverleaf mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of various host trees. It belongs to the family Loranthaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant has a symbiotic relationship with its host, deriving some of its nutrients through specialized structures called haustoria. It is native to parts of Africa and is often found in forested areas. Its berries are red and attract birds, which help in seed dispersal.
